Related Character(s): 鷴
Связанный символ (и): 鷴

鷳字的基本解释

鷳
xián
同“鹇”。

鷳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xián］
［《廣韻》户閒切，平山，匣。］
“鹇1”的繁体字。亦作“鷳1”。亦作“鷼1”。
(1)鸟名。白鹇。雄的背部白色，有黑纹，腹部黑蓝色，雌的全身棕绿色。分布于中国南部。
(2)今雉科鹇属各种鸟的通称。

鷳字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鷳； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1501第06
【唐韻】戸閒切【集韻】何間切【韻會】何閒切【正韻】何艱切，?音閑。【說文】鴟也。又白鷴，鳥名。形似山雞，白質黑章，尾長三四尺，距觜純丹，亦有靑黑者。一作鷴。【本草】張華曰：行止閑暇，故曰鷴，李昉命爲閑客。○按白鷴，卽白鶾也。《爾雅》雗雉，?雉。註：白鵫也。雗，本从翰，音寒，今南人呼閒如寒，則鷴卽雗音之轉也。《西京雜記》：南粵王獻白鷴、黑鷴各一。蓋雉亦有黑色者，幷可明《爾雅》秩秩海雉之說，况鷳非鴟類，《說文》誤。

鷳字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鷳字的起名意思

暂无。

Pheasant
Basic explanation of words
Pheasant
xián
Same as "鹇".
Pheasant
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xián］
["Guangyun" household leisure cutting, Pingshan, Xie. ]
Traditional characters for "鹇1". Also known as "鹇1". Also known as "鷼1".
(1) The name of the bird. White pheasant. The male's back is white with black stripes, the abdomen is black and blue, and the female's body is brownish-green. Distributed in southern China.
(2) Nowadays, the general term for various birds of the pheasant genus.
Pheasant
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Bird Character Department] 　鹇; Kangxi Strokes: 23; Page Number: Page 1501 Page 06
[Tang Yun] Xian cut [Ji Yun] He Jian cut [Rhyme] He Xian cut [Zheng Yun] How difficult is it to cut,? Yin Xian. [Said the text] also. And the white pheasant, the name of the bird. It is shaped like a pheasant, with a white black badge, a tail three or four feet long, and a pure pill away from the eye. There are also black ones. A pheasant. 【Materia Medica】Zhang Hua said: Traveling stops leisure, so it is called phoenix, and Li Fang Mingming is a leisure guest. ○Press 鍽鶾, 鍽鶾 also. "Ya" Pheasant,? Pheasant. Note: Baiyu also. Yu, originally from the Han, the sound is cold, today the southerners call leisure like cold, then the sound of the 鹇卽雗 also changes. "Xijing Miscellaneous Notes": The king of Nanyue presents one white pheasant and one black pheasant. There are also black ones in the cover pheasant, and it can be understood that the "Er Ya" ranks the rank of the sea pheasant.
